comment: This was by far the best class I had this semester, his class was very exciting and he teaches in a way that makes it easy to understand! His test are super easy....shouldn't receive less than a B in this class if ur paying attention! Great class!!

Constitution/Courts class was one of the most boring I've ever taken, but Judge Taylor is very pleasant and understanding if you need help or have a problem. Sounds like his Intro class is more interesting than the Courts class.
awesome judge. you must take this instructor

He only has a 6 page paper, a midterm and a final. I made a B on every single one and still got a 103 due to all of the extra credit provided. You do not have to go to class just read the chapters for his tests.

The Constitutional Law class was fairly enjoyable. Sometimes the lectures were openended, but you will be engaged in this class. It really helps to show up, and you should participate in the class discussions. There is one 10 pg. paper to write, and there is the mid term and final exam. Attendance is based on note cards selected at random.

Class was super easy. You have to participate in discussions but once you complete two then you don't have to go to class the rest of the semester. Essays graded easy. Just a midterm and final which were both easy A's if you study a little. Extra credit abundant as well.

He is very informative and an easy teacher,and he gives you enough extra credit to make any grade an A. He grades easy, and he teaches what he needs to then you get the rest of your classes off until the final. TAKE HIM!

Made a B in this class. Would have gotten an A had I answered one more question on the final correctly. With that said, it is nearly impossible to get an A without doing the extra credit options. Go to as many city council meetings as you can. This is the easiest way to earn more points. Take him. He is smart and has real experience in the field.

pretty interesting class overall.  not hard, just make sure you do the readings  the book and come to class to go over the readings. attendance is mandatory. has 2 exams and term paper. not a bad class to take, better than i thought it was going to be for sure.

Great guy. He is clear, punctual, humorous, and intelligent. Judge Tayor requires attendance but class isn't so much of a chore as others. He is one of the best at his subject. Only downfall, the ten page term paper.

Very intelligent, really knows the subject matter. He is personable and has a sense of humor. Only 2 tests, a group presentation, and a paper, BUT there are quite a few extra credit options. DO THEM!!! Attendance is not mandatory, but you will do better on tests if you attend. Need book? YES, for test and project prep!

amazing teacher. if poli sci is not your subject, take him. he makes it interesting (even tho classes not mandatory) and makes it very easy to understand! you can fail midterm and final and still get A just by doing all the extra credit...def do all the extra credit!

Judge Taylor is awesome!!! There is only two test, a presentation and a group project. The tests are pretty hard, but he offers enough extra credit to turn your grade from a D to an A. If you have the opportunity to take him do it!!!

Two test final and midterm both r hard because u dont get a study guide. However he gives tons of extra credit there should be no reason to fail this class. do all ya extra credit you will get a A or B out of the class. TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Lectures are on the boring side for those uninterested in the subject, but his examples draw a lot of interest (catfish). Two tests, two article analysis/presentations, two book chapter outlines/presentations. Ends class 10-15 minutes early nearly every time.

He is a judge and is very knowledgeable on the subject. Go to class, b/c he has notecards w/ students names and he picks randomly.He has a midterm and a final and a research paper.The midterm is multiple choice and short answer the final is all short answer on a book read in class.Research paper is over recent case.I highly recommend Judge Taylor.
Great class. Nice guy, does what he can to explain material. Doesn't take attendance, offers LOTS of extra credit opportunities.

Great teacher. Has a great attitude in class, tries to make it funny for the students. TONS of extra credit, very helpful and understanding. If you miss an assignment he does not let you make it up, but that is your problem anyway. Loved this guy, recommend him to anyone. Easy A.

Fantastic teacher. I never really liked politics but he makes it very interesting. You'll write a few essays, but I never got lower than a B. You'll do two presentations but I got A's on both of them. go to class every day it's a must. And do the extra credit. You'll get an A if you do it all. Again Judge Taylor is excellent. I highly recommend him

He is a judge, and you have to go to city council meetings for a grade and extra credit. The class was wonderful. It was an honors class and really was not that bad. Do as much extra credit as possible, study your notes for the test and use the website I saw some questions on there on the tests. Participate in class and you do have 2 presentations.

Good teacher but very boring at times. He'll ask a question and every answer people gives he says is wrong then never gives a clear answer. His tests are kind of hard but they come from the book for the most part. Gives tons of extra credit oppourtunities.

Great teacher. He's a judge so he knows government very well. If you aren't a good test taker, this is your class. Plenty of extra credit available. Very interesting class lectures, especially when it deals with catfish! Class is more like a group of friends discussing government versus a lecture; very comfortable class setting.
Excellent! No busy work and TONS of extra credit.

2 Tests and they are 50 questions, all multiple choice. 2 essay quizzes and 1 presentation. I made a 62 on both the midterm and the final and I got a B in the course. Don't really have to go to class, and lots of xtra credit is offered.. TOTALLY recommend Judge Taylor!

So. Pretty amazing teacher. I went to most of the classes just because I loved his teaching and wanted to get the notes because they are basically everything you need to study for the tests. It's rare to find a teacher like him-so get him if you can. Catfish are his thing!

One of the easiest political science classes ive heard of. He got rid of the 7-page paper. We have two tests and two short essay, which are easy. The test come straight from the book so cram the night before. Never have to go to class unless it is test day. A TON of extra credit!! very easy, highly recommend taking!!!!!

Easy, easy, easy. Just complete all of the mandatory assignment..who cares if you make a C on all of it because he gives enough extra credit to pull a C right back up to an A. I got a 56 on the final, a 74 on the midterm and ended up with a 92 in the class!!!

2 tests, seemed hard so STUDY! the hardest assignment was the 7-pg paper! Everything else is laid back. gives a lot of extra credit. I only had to make a 35 on my final to get an A in his class BECAUSE of the extra credit! do it all!!! the subject is rough but he'll get you through it! TAKE JUDGE TAYLOR!!!!!

A great prof.  Enthusiastic, caring, loves his subject.  Uses catfish examples, which I found entertaining while inoffensive, especially when touching upon sensitive areas of subject material.  I only wish I he taught more classes.
Really nice guy. Tests were easy. There is one 7 page term paper and a group presentation. One of the easiest classes that I have ever taken. I would definitely take him again if given the chance.

This class was easssy! Lots of xtra credit and opportunities for grades. I thought the class was boring, though and found that by missing class I wasn't missing much of anything...I got the easiest A ever possible.
This class was easy! He gives out a lot of extra credit. Attendence is not mandatory, but I advise you to go to get the notes. He uses catfish example alot though.... Overall, a sure enough A.

Taylor is a good teacher... I just wish he'd change his curriculum! His class consists of group presentations and you spend more time watching others fumble to answer his questions than actually learn something! I went every other class and pulled an A, few people showed up at all. Five grades (term paper, final/midterm, quiz, presentation). Easy.
Mr.Taylor was a great teacher!!! He listens to your questions and makes the lectures interesting by comparing everything to catfish (You will see if you take his class). It was an easy A.
This was the best professor I have had.  He was interested in the subject material and provided good discussion.  Relatively easy class and NO attendance policy.

His tests are so easy. Some questions seem like jokes. He's a cool guy, but I didn't like the class because it's just class discussion basically the whole time, and my classmates were complete idiots. Really, in some ways I think I'm dumber for taking this class.
He is such a great teacher, and he is a very funny guy. His tests are easy, and he gives you tons of extra credit! There is no need to read the chapters as long as you pay attention in class.
He is a really funny guy!

he is a really good teacher.  he knows what he is talking about and is willing to answer any questions you have.  he offers extra credit and wants everyone to do well.  tests are easy just pay attention in class.
Great teacher. You can tell in his lectures that he really loves this subject, I would recommend him to anybody
He was a great professor! He has a great understanding of his subject and is very interested in what he teaches. His tests are easy if you read the book, or most of it. He is very interesting.
Great professor!  Made information interesting and applicable.  As long as you show up and take notes you'll be fine.  There are only 4 grades so be careful!
